The two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions, he continued. Lewenza told the Star's Tony Van Alphen that Sergio Marchionne didn't see any horns growing out of his head: I think he left knowing there were none but they could come out any time if we're backed into a corner. Despite the tough discussion, Sergio Marchionne got what he wanted, while in return, Lewenza got only a promise of future gains. They built a relationship based on trust and mutual respect.
